title: Review & setlist: Conan Gray’s ‘Wishbone’ tour brought a coming-of-age story to TD Garden
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: Conan Gray's 'Wishbone' tour at TD Garden featured a four-act storytelling performance exploring themes like heartbreak and personal growth.
The concert showcased a mix of past hits and songs from Gray's new album, 'Wishbone', including 'Vodka Cranberry' and 'Heather'.
Fans engaged with interactive elements such as breaking wishbones and singing along to 'Sunset Tower', chosen by a fan during the show.

title: 8 hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning on Cape Cod
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Eight people hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning on a boat at MacMillan Pier in Provincetown.
The incident led to a mass-casualty response due to limited ambulance availability in Provincetown.
First responders, exposed during the incident, were also evaluated at Cape Cod Hospital.

title: Topsfield massage parlor shut down over alleged prostitution, trafficking
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Topsfield police shut down FeiFei L Spa on Boston Street for alleged prostitution and human trafficking.
The investigation involved collaboration with multiple agencies, including Homeland Security and Massachusetts State Police.
A cease-and-desist order was issued; the business owner is expected to terminate the spa's lease.

title: Charlie Coyle thankful for Bruins tenure in first game back with Boston
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie Coyle returned to Boston with the Columbus Blue Jackets, reflecting on his seven-season tenure with the Bruins.
Coyle, a key player for the Blue Jackets, helped the team remain in the Eastern Conference playoff race after a coaching change.
The Bruins honored Coyle with a video tribute during his first game back, where Boston won 4-2 against Columbus.

title: Amid trying year, Olympic gold shone even brighter for Charlie McAvoy and his family
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy of the Boston Bruins won Olympic gold with Team USA in Milan, sharing the moment with his family.
The past year was challenging for McAvoy, including injuries and personal difficulties, but the Olympic victory brought joy to his family.
McAvoy played a crucial role in Team USA's defensive success, logging significant ice time and contributing to a perfect penalty kill.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge on recent Greater Boston news.
The quiz helps readers stay informed about trending stories in the region.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com's general assignment editor, has written for the site since 2019.

title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro filled in as goalie after Joonas Korpisalo was pulled from the game due to a concussion protocol.
DiPietro played 6:03, stopping two shots, before Korpisalo returned in the Bruins' 4-2 win over the Columbus Blue Jackets.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm praised both DiPietro's quick adaptation and Korpisalo's performance, who stopped 36 of 38 shots.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, of Manchester, N.H., was arrested and charged with reckless second-degree murder of her infant.
The infant, referred to as Baby Jane Doe, was found dead in Pine Island Pond on March 27, 2025.
Authorities investigated the case for 11 months, offering a $5,000 reward for information on the suspicious death.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader with a 2006 Mazda3 had black transmission fluid. The garage drained it twice and suggests a future flush.
A reader was quoted $1,600 for repairs on a 2019 Subaru Crosstrek, including TPMS sensors and control arm bushings.
AAA Northeast's Car Doctor suggests using TopTier fuel and additives to clean combustion chambers for a 2015 Kia Optima.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Hingham's Plymouth River School evacuated due to roof stress from heavy snow accumulation after Monday's blizzard.
Students and staff relocated to Hingham High School, which provided lunch and transportation home.
Roofing specialists are removing snow, and a structural engineer is scheduled to assess the building's safety.
